food.name: PRAWN & MONKFISH SOUP
food.description: From Trieste to Puglia you’ll find the so-called brodetti (broths), although they vary from region to region. We had countless bowlfuls on our coastal journey

food.name: AMALFI-STYLE FISH SOUP
food.description: here are many variations on the theme, depending on the cook’s preference and what’s available in the market on the day.

food.name: ASPARAGUS & GRANA PADANO
food.description: This rainbow salad is a fantastic source of vitamin C and is surprisingly filling

food.name: PARSLEY VINAIGRETTE
food.description: Today they are still relatively abundant in the island’s coastal waters and form a major part of the islanders’ diet

food.name: ROLLED AUBERGINES
food.description: Aubergines were introduced to the Mediterranean region by the Arabs in the Middle Ages and Sicilians use them a lot in their cooking.

food.name: SMOKED PAPRIKA BRUCHETTE
food.description: As well as being a source of vitamin E and monounsaturated fat, avocado is one of the best sources of glutathione, a molecule which help to burn off fat
